result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Lapage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by 3:00 p.m. on Wednesday, June 29, 2016.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must have no abusive contact with Emily Lapage.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J Lapage

Defendant Thomas J Lapage in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

SW

No abusive contact with Emily Lapage.
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO.

If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191. 

Must have no contact with Emily L. unless in court for required appearance.

Defendant Thomas J Lapage in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
